Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a commanding performance across 6.1 innings, allowing just one hit (home run via Juan Soto) and recording four strikeouts.
Teoscar Hernandez and Freddie Freeman hit back-to-back homers in the bottom of the third despite facing two outs to give the Dodgers a 4-1 lead entering the seventh.
Juan Soto tied the game 1-1 with a solo home run in the third.
Tommy Edman hit a solo home run in the second inning off of Rod√≥n, giving the Dodgers a 1-0 lead.
Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the bottom of the eighth inning of Game 1.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers pitcher Yoshinobu Yamamoto led LA to a win over the New York Yankees in Game 2 of the 2024 World Series.
Shohei Ohtani suffered a partial dislocation of his left shoulder and will undergo further testing on Sunday.
Yamamoto and Carlos Rodon both made their World Series debuts, but Yamamoto easily outshined his opponent.
Teoscar Hernandez and Freddie Freeman hit back-to-back homers in the bottom of the third.
The Yankees struggled at the plate for eight of nine innings, finally coming alive in the top of the ninth with Soto leading the way.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said Shohei Ohtani is showing good strength and good range of motion following a shoulder injury.
Ohtani's Game 3 status is not yet known.
The Yankees are heading to New York up 2-0.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani appeared to suffer a left shoulder injury at the end of the seventh inning when he tried to steal second base but landed awkwardly while sliding.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto had a commanding performance across 6.1 innings, allowing just one hit (home run via Juan Soto) and recording four strikeouts.
Giancarlo Stanton finally got on the stat sheet on a positive note, logging a hit that struck the third-base bag.
Juan Soto rounded home and made it a 4-2 deficit in the top of the ninth.
Alex Vesia threw one pitch and caught pinch hitter Jose Trevino with a pop-fly out, sealing the 4-2 result.
Shohei Ohtani appeared to hurt himself on a steal attempt to end the seventh inning.
The Yankees replaced a bullpen pitcher, bringing on Clay Holmes.
Jake Cousins came into the game with no one on, and quickly found himself trying to force the Dodgers to leave a man on after Will Smith hit a double over Aaron Judge's head.
Reliever Jake Cousins came into the game with no one on base.
Tim Hill was the replacement, coming off after 1.1 innings pitched. He did not allow a hit in that span.
The Yankees replaced a bullpen pitcher, bringing on Clay Holmes.
The Dodgers are going to New York up 2-0.
Others: Ice Cube performed on the Dodger Stadium field ahead of the first pitch for Game 2.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts and Yankees outfielder Alex Verdugo were seen singing along as the 'Friday' actor pumped up the crowd.
The Yankees once again replaced a bullpen pitcher, bringing on Clay Holmes.
Tim Hill's first appearance in the series.

Former Yankees third baseman and three-time MVP Alex Rodriguez was seen out on the field early to watch Giancarlo Stanton take batting practice.
Yankees legend and Hall of Famer Derek Jeter was seen watching his former team take batting practice ahead of Game 2.
The Game 2 pitching matchup will feature Dodgers' Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Yankees' Carlos Rodon.
The Yankees are led by Giancarlo Stanton and Aaron Judge, the latter of who is in need of a big showing.
The Dodgers have a change at shortstop, with Miguel Rojas coming in and Tommy Edman shifting to center field. Gavin Lux is dropped.
Carlos Rodon and Yoshinobu Yamamoto both made their World Series debuts, but Yamamoto easily outshined his opponent.
